title: Bonsai lightweight mode to prune old chain data

labels.name: TeamGroot
labels.description: GH issues worked on by Groot Team

body:
Bonsai lightweight mode to prune old blocks, header and transaction receipts as we only require near-head at least 256 blocks of data.

Acceptance Criteria
* Ensure the pruning doesn't affect performance of Besu. This is lower priority than block processing/import
* Storage is maintained at a small size by pruning old transaction receipts by only keeping HEAD/finalised -x of the transaction receipts.
* Ensure that block headers, block body and transaction receipts are deleted atomically i.e. using rocksdb transactions
* Can survive a chain reorg i.e. can handle forks
* Ensure that syncing continues to work when pivot block is behind the pruning block

Tasks
* Hidden feature flag for bonsai pruning and configuration for number of blocks to prune
* When the threshold is reach for historical data then prune old transaction receipts below threshold
* Create pruning scheduler so that it does not affect the performance of Besu particularly block import/block execution
* Add remove method to KeyValueStoragePrefixedKeyBlockchainStorage for transaction receipts
* Test syncing for checkpoint
* Measure eth_call performance using eth_gen to ensure is not negatively affected by pruning
* Acceptance test/integration test for pruning

Question
* Should this be a seperate process or built-in to the block processing?
  * Decided on using seperate process so more control on when the pruning happens for performance and fulfilling acceptance criteria

Notes
* Lower priority process than block import. If possible prune when idle
* Existing pruning is for Forest mode world state only and it's approach of traversing the trie is not applicable for the bonsai blockchain data pruning we need to do.
